column4: hi guys, i got a problem: i have an mp3 which i use as a flash disk, but after having ubuntu reinstalled nautilus says that it is read-only.
as in user priviledges.. are you familiar with sudo commands?
just try the right click then. go to properties and then permisions.... what sys are you on?
did you try as a superuser?
press alt+f2 and type in gksudo nautilus /media/
there you should have a folder corresponding to the drive and try the right-click again...
still wont work, it tells me its read-only
did you type in your superuser password?
i'll try that from the reminal
now i did write the password but it still tells me its in read only
weird.. it worked for me... try asking again... I might learn along...
hi guys, i got a problem: i have an mp3 which i use as a flash disk, but after having ubuntu reinstalled nautilus says that it is read-only.
